trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of magnesium on blood vessel function
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effects of a diet that includes consuming a magnesium supplement on endothelial function

interventions.interventions: Magnesium supplements will be used, 400 mg/day for men and 300 mg/day for women Participants will be provided with supplements by a researcher at a face to face visit to the University of South Australia Participants will be asked to take the supplements as a oral tablet each day for 7 days There is no washout period. Participants will be asked to return any unused supplements
interventions.comparator: Magnesium supplements compared with no supplements

primaryOutcome.outcome: Ultra sound measurement of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery which is an accepted measure of endothelial function
primaryOutcome.timepoint: after 1 week on supplements and 1 week of no supplements

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and after 1 week on supplements and 1 week on no supplements

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: BMI greater than or equal to 18 kg/m2 and less than or equal to 30 kg/m2 Systolic BP less than or equal to 140mmHg Diastolic BP less than or equal to 90mmHg Without self reported cardiovascular liver or kidney disease
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: BMI <18 and >30kg/m2 Systolic BP >140mmHg Diastolic BP >90mmHg Self reported cardiovascular liver or kidney disease Taking medications that affect endothelial function e.g. sildenafil (Viagra)

trial_design.concealment: Allocation conducted ny another member of the research team
trial_design.statisticalmethods: Repeated measures analysis of variance will be used to determine between group differences

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: School of Pharmacy and Medical Sciences, University of South Australia City East Campus Postal address: GPO Box 2471 Adelaide SA 5000

fundingsource.fundingaddress: School of Pharmacy and Medical Sciences, University of South Australia City East Campus Postal address: GPO Box 2471 Adelaide SA 5000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Heart disease is a major cause of death and disability in Australia. We have already shown that diet has a key role to play in maintaining blood vessel health. A low magnesium diet is emerging as a risk factor for heart disease and is associated with an increased risk of fatal and nonfatal ischaemic heart disease. Few studies have examined the effect of Mg on endothelial function in healthy adults. The hypothesis is that an improvement blood vessel function measured by flow mediated dilatation after a high magnesium diet achieved using dietary supplements.
